results.title: Afrikaner experience: politics of exclusion
results.creator_credit: Peter F. Davis and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Explores the history of the Afrikaners from the arrival of the Dutch in 1652 to South Africa in the 1970’s with its Apartheid System. The film is useful for its historical significance. This film contains footage from the film by Barry Callaghan entitled “South Africa/the white laager”. This film attempts to create an understanding of the historical events leading to and resulting in the Afrikaner rule of South Africa. It also examines the concept of racial superiority , and the connection between such ideology and economic profit.

results.title: The Animals are crying
results.creator_credit: Peter Beltz, Paul Martin Smith and PMS Films
results.brief_description: This film shows how pet owners fail to understand the responsibility of raising animals by telling about the garbage men who almost discard a box until they realise there are live kittens in it. Also suggests owners spay their female cats. (Short version). Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Pacific Island life: village life
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Part of a series of five films which examine aspects of life in the Pacific Islands. Shows daily life in the village, including the building of a home.
Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: Pacific Island life: food from the sea
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Examines aspects of life in the Pacific Islands. Shows the lagoon being searched for clams, sea-worms, crabs and turtles. A coconut crab is caught and cooked in an open fire and the shell is used as a container, tool or toy. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Pacific Island life: fishing
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Examines aspects of life in the Pacific Islands. Shows the men preparing for the catch by trapping small fish in the lagoon which they then take beyond the coral reef at the mouth of the channel and use as bait to attract the larger bait. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Pacific Island life: family life
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Examines aspects of life in the Pacific Islands. Each family has its own field usually on one of the more fertile islands. Teheilau and his family take a boat trip to attend to their plot where they grow taro and tumeric. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Coconut tree
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Examines aspects of life in the Pacific Islands. The coconut is the islands’ only export and the coconut palm is also esential for the people’s immediate livelihood. Shows the products derived from this source by the islanders. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Monet in London
results.creator_credit: David Thompson, Arts Council of Great Britain and Balfour Films
results.brief_description: Presents the work of French painter Claude Monet during the period 1889 to 1901 when he lived in London. Shows the painter’s views of London, including Charing Cross Bridge, Waterloo Bridge, and St. Thomas’ Hospital, accompanied by readings from his diaries and letters.

results.title: Nolan at sixty
results.creator_credit: Brian Adams, ABC and RM Productions
results.brief_description: The Australian artist, Sidney Nolan, returns home to receive an honorary doctorate of letters from Sydney University. Looks at his life and works and follows his travels and activities in Australia, England and Africa. Narrated by Kenneth Clark.

results.title: Choosing what to make
results.creator_credit: Craig Witty and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Using animation, puppets and clay figures, this film examines fundamental factors involved in the production of goods (labour, resources etc). Discusses the importance of intelligent allocation of resources and emphasises the significance of demand in determining what to produce. Suitable for primary school level.
